heading: 2 databraryr R package
text: page summarizes information R package team developed enhanced NSF support.

heading: Background
text:
Rick Gilmore began development R package use Databrary PI several years ago.
original package called databraryapi.
work supported Play & Learning Across Year (PLAY) project award.summer 2023, Gilmore moved code base Databrary GitHub organization renamed package databraryr accord R package naming conventions.
Gilmore Spies working make code base robust standards compliant.
expect submit package review Comprehensive R Archive Network (CRAN) August 31, 2023.

heading: Current (development) package
text:
-progress R package can viewed https://github.com/databrary/databraryr/.full website describing commands can found https://databrary.github.io/databraryr/.approved CRAN, package available via R command install.packages('databraryr').
meantime, user may download use development version, follows:Install devtools via install.packages('devtools').Install databraryr via devtools::install_github('databrary/databraryr').

heading: Roadmap
text:
developing roadmap package.
major feature future release commands enable scripted uploading data materials Databrary.

text:
page summarizes data NSF-funded projects used Databrary
store share data.

heading: Background
text:
Rick Gilmore Andrea Seisler developed code generate series reports
Databrary’s users, assets, data.summer 2023, code migrated Databrary organization GitHub.
code base reports can found https://github.com/databrary/analytics/.
latest analytics report can found https://databrary.github.io/analytics.Note: Databrary’s API permit access datasets volumes yet shared volume owner.
means data report underestimate total number projects datasets actually received NSF funding.

heading: Volume funders
text:
Databrary permits users list funders associated dataset.
funding information across site updated regularly.
latest report can found https://databrary.github.io/analytics/funders.html.2023-07-24, NSF listed funder largest number volumes Databrary., regenerate data.

heading: Setup
text: work done via functions listed R/functions.R.

heading: Databrary volumes that mention NSF
text:
query Databrary volumes mention NSF award, run following.2023-07-24, volume 1627 largest volume index.
, can query Databrary volume--volume, collect data volumes list NSF funder, follows:uses get_vol_awards() function funder_str parameter select award information lists NSF. , NSF award IDs cleaned match NSF format add_clean_nsf_award_id().funding award IDs must cleaned current Databrary system validate formats.
funding award information free text field.
helpful future version Databrary validate entries reduce post hoc data cleaning.takes several moments, report, import previously saved file data., can start visualize data. table shared Databrary volumes mentioning NSF funder:Note added URL links directly shared volume Databrary.\(n=\) 50 unique shared Databrary volumes list NSF funder, \(n=\) 38 unique NSF awards.
NSF awards resulted multiple shared Databrary volumes.
code:
db_w_nsf <-
  purrr::map(1:1627,
             get_vol_awards,
             funder_str = "NSF",
             .progress = "Databrary vols w/ NSF:") |> purrr::list_rbind() |>
  add_clean_nsf_award_id()
db_nsf <- readr::read_csv("csv/databrary-vols-w-nsf-funding-all.csv", show_col_types = FALSE)
db_nsf <- db_nsf |>
  dplyr::filter(!is.na(award_id)) |>
  dplyr::mutate(url = paste0("https://databrary.org/volume/", vol_id))
  
db_nsf |>
  dplyr::select(vol_id, award_id, url) |>
  knitr::kable(format = 'html') |>
  kableExtra::kable_material() |>
  kableExtra::scroll_box(width = "700px", height = "400px")

heading: NSF funding data on these projects
text: can now match projects funding information available NSF directly.

heading: Illustration using the current grant
text: , illustrate get_nsf_data_for_award_id() function can used gather information NSF funding database current project.
code:
nsf_2032713_df <- get_nsf_data_for_award_id(2032713)

nsf_2032713_df## # A tibble: 1 × 11
##   agency awardeeCity    awardeeName awardeeStateCode fundsObligatedAmt
##   <chr>  <chr>          <chr>       <chr>            <chr>            
## 1 NSF    University Pa… Pennsylvan… PA               199977           
## # ℹ 6 more variables: id <chr>, piFirstName <chr>, piLastName <chr>,
## #   publicAccessMandate <chr>, date <chr>, title <chr>

heading: Funding information from shared Databrary volumes
text: re-generate data frame Databrary volumes able extract details NSF funding NSF , runThis takes several minutes, report, import previously saved file data.Now, can begin visualize , well:
code:
summarize_mult_vol_nsf_awards(1:1627, vb = TRUE)
nsf <- readr::read_csv("csv/databrary-nsf-funding-details-all.csv", show_col_types = FALSE)
nsf <- nsf |>
   dplyr::filter(!is.na(piLastName), !is.na(piFirstName), !is.na(award_id))
 
nsf |>
  dplyr::select(piLastName, piFirstName, award_id, date, title, vol_id, fundsObligatedAmt) |>
  dplyr::mutate(piLastName = stringr::str_to_title(piLastName),
                piFirstName = stringr::str_to_title(piFirstName)) |>
  dplyr::arrange(piLastName, award_id, vol_id) |>
  knitr::kable(format = 'html') |>
  kableExtra::kable_material() |>
  kableExtra::scroll_box(width = "700px", height = "300px")

heading: Visualizations
text:
Figure 3.1: Histogram NSF awards Databrary volumes.
\(n=\) 62 Databrary volumes list NSF funder.represent \(n=\) 38 unique NSF awards., able extract data NSF API \(n=\) 36 NSF awards.following volumes matching NSF awards.NSF award IDs must error volumes.can search NSF database term ‘databrary’ see can find correct
NSF award ID.Curiously, following projects mention “Databrary”:can filter based last names Databrary volume owners.result, looks like correct NSF award IDS 1523982 possibly 1623486.
Databrary staff contact PIs.Note workflow helps evaluate quality data metadata stored Databrary.considering incorporating functions databraryr package future release.
code:
nsf |>
  dplyr::mutate(award_amt = as.numeric(fundsObligatedAmt)) |>
  ggplot2::ggplot() +
  ggplot2::aes(award_amt) +
  ggplot2::geom_histogram(bins=10)
nsf_w_databrary <- get_nsf_data_for_keyword("databrary")
nsf_w_databrary |>
  dplyr::select(piFirstName, piLastName, id, title) |>
  dplyr::arrange(piLastName, piFirstName) |>
  knitr::kable(format = 'html') |>
  kableExtra::kable_material() |>
  kableExtra::scroll_box(width = "700px", height = "400px")
nsf_w_databrary |>
  dplyr::select(piFirstName, piLastName, id) |>
  dplyr::filter(piLastName %in% c("Smith", "Bonawitz")) |>
  dplyr::arrange(id) |>
  knitr::kable(format = 'html') |>
  kableExtra::kable_material() |>
  kableExtra::scroll_box(width = "700px", height = "200px")

heading: 5 Metadata standardization
text: page describes discusses Databrary’s data metadata might made compliant existing data schema standards.metadata expert, Kevin Clair, produced two reports findings recommendations standardizing Databrary’s data metadata.
